q: The 50-year-old actress- who plays scathing cheerleading coach Sue Sylvester on the US TV show- believes there are many similarities between the teacher and the straight-talking talent show judge. She said: If ever there was a guy who tells it like it is, then it's Simon Cowell . You could definitely look at Sue and say there's a lot of Simon Cowell in her. ''He's a great inspiration for the character of Sue- there is a lot that I can take from him and put into her. Jane Lynch also admitted she is ''amazed'' by the public's reaction to Sue and believes people admire her in the same way they respect music mogul Simon Cowell . She explained in an

Peninsula. Sergio Marchionne found this site to be a fitting location to discuss how compressed natural gas( CNG) could fuel Chrysler's future. The CEO outlined Chrysler's commitment to CNG development, stating: In the United States, there is a substantial domestic supply of CNG. CNG technology is readily available without extensive development time or expenditure of resources. Fiat already has a portfolio of CNG engines, both naturally aspirated and turbocharged. Chrysler Powertrain is actively investigating applications for CNG and is exploring solutions that would drive people to the technology. ''I don't think anybody knows,'' O'Brien tells PopcornBiz. We don't know if late night shows are going to be a pill that you take in three years or a saline drop that goes in your eye. Bill Stephan , a friend of Mike Pence 's since their law school days, said Mike Pence was always clear on what he stood for and what he was passionate about.( 2 of 4) I just remember Mike Pence as someone who, even then, wore his heart on his sleeve, Bill Stephan said. Mike Pence said he embraced the Republican Party while attending law school in Indianapolis, largely because he heard in Ronald Reagan ''the manifestation of the kind of traditional American ideals that I was raised to

with the fantastic group of juniors he has for 2011. His senior defensive end/linebacker Jarrell McKinney signed with Western Michigan. ''He's my first Division I recruit,'' the Albert said of Jarrell McKinney . He has tremendous speed. He runs the 40 in 4.5. He's 6-5, 210, and when he goes to college they're going to put another 20-30 pounds on him. Playing defensive end, he's going to be outstanding. He's the role model for our other kids.... He's that bar that we have to set for ourselves. Cody has an experienced offensive line and receivers coming back, and the Albert said junior-to-be quarterback Mario Gulley ''has Michael Vick capabilities.'' the entire ordeal, Michael Vick agreed to a two-year deal with Unequal Technologies, a company that produces protective padding for athletes. Michael Vick struggled at times this season with an injured rib and back. Part of the reason I'm here is because I was able to wear some rib protection this season to guide me through my injury, Michael Vick said. ''Unequal was one of the reasons I've been able to make it through the season.'' Michael Vick will get the start on Sunday and try to earn his first Pro Bowl victory

NO thanks. 16 posted on 02/11/2011 10:50:19 AM PST Why does EVERYONE have to start out at the top? Why not run for governor or senator or congressman first? BTW I think Michele Bachmann should run for the US Senate in MN, Mike Pence should run for the Senate in IN, Giuliani should run for the US Senate in NY. Steve Forbes should run for the Senate in NJ. That's the problem with our party. Everyone wants to start out at the top I think Mike Pence is going to run for Governor of Indiana. Paul Shaffer is most well known for being the bandleader on David Letterman 's late-night talk show, both at NBC and CBS, from 1982 to the present.
